meanings.definition: Relating to or resulting from the influence of human beings on nature.
meanings.sent1: The anthropic changes in the forest were caused by people cutting down trees.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the anthropic impact of pollution on the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The anthropic squirrels in the park seemed to be organizing a picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her garden showed an anthropic beauty, reflecting the care she put into it.
meanings.sent5: The anthropic footprints left in the sand told a story of human presence.

meanings.definition: Believing that human beings are the central or most significant entities in the universe.
meanings.sent1: The anthropic view of the universe places humans at the center of all existence.
meanings.sent2: Some people hold an anthropic perspective that elevates human importance above all else.
meanings.sent3: The anthropic cat in the house acted like it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: His anthropic ego was so big, it could fill the entire room.
meanings.sent5: In her painting, the artist captured an anthropic essence that drew viewers in.
